Package org.torrent.nio

Class NIOThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.torrent.nio.NIOThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class NIOThread
extends java.lang.Thread
This class runs as a new Thread and handles all the I/O operations as the client goes about its work. Writing to file is also done from here and for managing connections the client takes a non-blocking I/O approach, making use of a selector.
Author:
mkg

  • Field Details

    • maxNumDownloadingConns

      protected volatile int maxNumDownloadingConns
      Controls the maximum amount of connections that can operate on a torrent at once

    • maxNumSeedingConns

      protected volatile int maxNumSeedingConns
      Controls the maximum amount of connections allowed for seeding (NOT IMPLEMENTED)

    • seedAfterwards

      protected volatile boolean seedAfterwards
      Determines whether seeding is permitted after the download is complete (NOT IMPLEMENTED)

    • nioShutdown

      protected volatile boolean nioShutdown
      Variable that, when set to true, will result result in NIOThread shutting down. Note that this may not be immediate and some processing may take place first

    • readTimeout

      protected int readTimeout
      The number of seconds a connection will wait for a message before timing out and shutting down

    • connectionTimeout

      protected int connectionTimeout
      The number of seconds a connection will wait when connecting to a peer before timing out

    • torrentsToProcess

      protected volatile java.util.HashSet<TorrentFile> torrentsToProcess
      This contains the torrent files that have been passed to NIOThread by TClient for processing

    • torrentsProcessing

      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​TorrentFile> torrentsProcessing
      This contains torrents that are currently being worked on by NIOthread

    • peerManagers

      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​PeerManager> peerManagers
      This contains PeerManagers. They will be linked to the relevant torrent file via the nioKey field.

    • piecePickers

      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​PiecePicker> piecePickers
      This contains PiecePickers. They will be linked to the relevant torrent file via the nioKey field.

    • timeoutStore

      private java.util.HashSet<ChannelData> timeoutStore
      When a connection is waiting for a message it is referenced here. This will be polled periodically and if channelData's readTimeout or connectionTimeout have passed, the connection will be closed

    • nioKey

      private java.lang.Integer nioKey
      The HashMaps peerManagers, piecePickers and torrentsProcessing all use an Integer as a key. When a torrent is submitted for processing it will be assigned a key, along with its associated PiecePicker and PeerManager. As a result, this key will link together all the resources working on that particular torrent file. The channelData objects working on connections linked to the torrent will also hold a reference to this key

    • nioThread

      private static NIOThread nioThread
      Used to help implement a singleton pattern for NIOThread

    • peerID

      private java.lang.StringBuilder peerID
      Used in the creation of NIOThread's peer id

    • myListeningPort

      private int myListeningPort
      The port that we listen for connections on

    • blockReqSize

      private int blockReqSize
      The size of NIOPThread piece requests

    • start

      private long start
      Used to track how long NIOThread has been operating. This information is used when NIOThread is closing down

    • end

      private long end
      Used to track how long NIOThread has been operating. This information is used when NIOThread is closing down

    • logger

      private java.util.logging.Logger logger
      The logger used to log messages

    • NIOThread

      public NIOThread()

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      The method used to initiate and run NIOThread
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread

    • processData

      private int processData​(ChannelData channelData)
      This method determines the next action a connection needs to take by processing various data and returning a key to register with the selector. This method will also return -3 if the connected peer has no piece we want, or -2 if we have gathered all the pieces of the file we are downloading.
      Parameters:
      channelData - The channelData object for the connection
      Returns:
      A SelectionKey for registering with the selector, or a specified negative number to indicate no further processing is necessary

    • receiveMessage

      private java.lang.String receiveMessage​(ChannelData channelData, java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel) throws java.io.IOException
      This will process message data received, edit channelData's state if needed and then return a String message
      Parameters:
      channelData - the channelData object associated with the channel
      channel - The channel receiving the message
      Returns:
      "OK": Processed successfully, "Tracker Response Parsed": Tracker response parsed, "No Data": Message received but no data, or null if there is an issue reading the data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error in reading the received data from the channel

    • extractMessages

      private java.util.ArrayDeque<byte[]> extractMessages​(ChannelData channelData, byte[] message)
      This message takes the message bytes received, combines them with any stored bytes in channelData's TCP store and breaks the resultant bytes down into individual messages, adding each messageW to the ArrayDeque before returning it
      Parameters:
      channelData - The channelData object linked to the channel that has received the message
      message - The message bytes that have been received
      Returns:
      an ArrayDeque of messages to be processed, or null if an error is found in the data received

    • assignReadWithTimeout

      private java.nio.channels.SelectionKey assignReadWithTimeout​(java.nio.channels.Selector selector, java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel, ChannelData channelData, int timeout) throws java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException
      When a channel is waiting to read a message, it will be registered with timeoutStore, where it will be periodically polled. If the timeout time has elapsed, then the connection will be closed
      Parameters:
      selector - The Selector object with which the channel should be registered
      channel - The channel waiting for a read operation
      channelData - the channelData object to be linked to the channel
      timeout - The number of seconds that should be waited before closing the channel
      Returns:
      The key registered with the channel and Selector
      Throws:
      java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException - If the channel is closed when we attempt to register it

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection​(ChannelData channelData, TorrentFile tf, java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key) throws java.io.IOException
      When a channel needs closing for any reason, this is where it is done. This will remove its links and decrement the necessary variables
      Parameters:
      channelData - The channelData object associated with the connection
      tf - The torrent file being processed
      key - The key currently associated with the connection
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If closing down the channel causes an I/O exception

    • writeData

      private void writeData​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel, ChannelData channelData) throws java.io.IOException
      Used for all write operations.
      Parameters:
      channel - The Channel being used to write information
      channelData - The channelData object for the channel
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the write operation fails

    • getHandshake

      private byte[] getHandshake​(TorrentFile tf)
      Parameters:
      tf - The torrent file we are referencing in our handshake
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the handshake to send

    • getInstance

      protected static NIOThread getInstance()
      Returns:
      A reference to this NIOTHread, or a new NIOThread if one hasn't been created

    • getSessionPeerID

      private java.lang.StringBuilder getSessionPeerID()
      Returns:
      A generated peerID for this client to use

    • getPort

      private int getPort()
      Returns:
      The port number we are listening on

    • getHTTPRequest

      private java.lang.String getHTTPRequest​(TorrentFile tf)
      Generated the HTTP request needed to contact a tracker
      Parameters:
      tf - - The torrent File being worked on
      Returns:
      A String representation of the relevant HTTP request

    • setPiecePicker

      private void setPiecePicker​(java.lang.Integer channelNioKey)
      Sets a pieceSelector for the torrent file download to use. At the moment, only one type is available
      Parameters:
      channelNioKey - The key which needs associating with the new PiecePicker

    • urlEncode

      private java.lang.String urlEncode​(byte[] array)
      Parameters:
      array - The bytes that require URL conversion
      Returns:
      A URL encoded String

    • parseTrackerResponse

      private void parseTrackerResponse​(byte[] messageBytes, java.lang.Integer channelNioKey)
      Parameters:
      messageBytes - A byte array containing the bytes from the tracker response
      channelNioKey - The key linked to the torrent file being worked on

    • getLogger

      public java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
      Returns:
      Returns the logger to be used by other classes for printing out information
